description: Fitbit provides a Web API for accessing data from Fitbit activity trackers, Aria scale, and manually entered logs.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to get a token on behalf of a user.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: The id of your application obtained from Fitbit.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Required: The secret of your application obtained from Fitbit.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: Optional: Required if specified in the redirect to the authorization page. Must be exact match.

args.name: code
args.info: Required: The access grant code you received via the callback from ProductHunt.

args.name: state
args.info: Optional: Required if specified in the redirect to the authorization page. Must be an exact match.

args.name: expiresIn
args.info: Optional: Specify the desired access token lifetime. Defaults to 28800. 3600 for 1 hour, 28800 for 8 hours.

blocks.name: refreshingTokens
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to get a token from refresh token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: The id of your application obtained from Fitbit.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Required: The secret of your application obtained from Fitbit.

args.name: refreshToken
args.info: Required: The refresh token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: expiresIn
args.info: Optional: Specify the desired access token lifetime. Defaults to 28800. 3600 for 1 hour, 28800 for 8 hours.

blocks.name: revokingAccessTokens
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to revoke an access token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: The id of your application obtained from Fitbit.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Required: The secret of your application obtained from Fitbit.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

blocks.name: getProfile
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a user's profile. The authenticated owner receives all values.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

blocks.name: updateProfile
blocks.description: This endpoint updates a user's profile.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: gender
args.info: Optional: More accurately, sex; (MALE/FEMALE/NA).

args.name: birthday
args.info: Optional: Date of birth; in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

args.name: height
args.info: Optional: Height; in the format X.XX, in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: aboutMe
args.info: Optional: About Me string.

args.name: fullname
args.info: Optional: Full name.

args.name: country
args.info: Optional: Country; two-character code.

args.name: state
args.info: Optional: US State; two-character code; valid only if country was or being set to US.

args.name: city
args.info: Optional: City.

args.name: strideLengthWalking
args.info: Optional: Walking stride length; in the format X.XX, in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: strideLengthRunning
args.info: Optional: Running stride length; in the format X.XX, in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: weightUnit
args.info: Optional: Default weight unit on website (doesn't affect API); one of (en_US, en_GB, "any" for METRIC).

args.name: heightUnit
args.info: Optional: Default height/distance unit on website (doesn't affect API); one of (en_US, "any" for METRIC).

args.name: waterUnit
args.info: Optional: Default water unit on website (doesn't affect API); one of (en_US, "any" for METRIC).

args.name: glucoseUnit
args.info: Optional: Default glucose unit on website (doesn't affect API); one of (en_US, "any" for METRIC).

args.name: timezone
args.info: Optional: Timezone; in the format "America/Los_Angeles".

args.name: foodsLocale
args.info: Optional: Food Database Locale; in the format "xx_XX".

args.name: locale
args.info: Optional: Locale of website (country/language); one of the locales, currently â€“ (en_US, fr_FR, de_DE, es_ES, en_GB, en_AU, en_NZ, ja_JP).

args.name: localeLang
args.info: Optional: Language; in the format "xx". You should specify either locale or both - localeLang and localeCountry (locale is higher priority).

args.name: localeCountry
args.info: Optional: Country; in the format "XX". You should specify either locale or both - localeLang and localeCountry (locale is higher priority).

args.name: startDayOfWeek
args.info: Optional: Start day of the week; what day the week should start on. Either Sunday or Monday.

args.name: clockTimeDisplayFormat
args.info: Optional: How trackers with a clock should display the time. Either 12hour or 24hour.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getBadges
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves the user's badges in the format requested. Response includes all badges for the user as seen on the Fitbit website badge locker (both activity and weight related.)

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getSleepGoal
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a user's current sleep goal using unit in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values.

blocks.name: updateSleepGoal
blocks.description: This endpoint creates or updates a user's sleep goal and get a response in the in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: minDuration
args.info: Required: The target sleep duration is in minutes.

blocks.name: logSleep
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a log entry for a sleep event and returns a response in the format requested. Keep in mind that it is NOT possible to create overlapping log entries or entries for time periods that DO NOT originate from a tracker. Sleep log entries appear on website's sleep tracker interface according to the date on which the sleep event ends.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: startTime
args.info: Required: Start time; hours and minutes in the format HH:mm.

args.name: duration
args.info: Required: Duration in milliseconds.

args.name: date
args.info: Required: Log entry date in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

blocks.name: deleteSleepLog
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a user's sleep log entry with the given ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: logId
args.info: Required: ID of the sleep log to be deleted.

blocks.name: getSleepLogs
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a summary and list of a user's sleep log entries as well as minute by minute sleep entry data for a given day in the format requested. The endpoint response includes summary for all sleep log entries for the given day (including naps.). The relationship between sleep log entry properties is expressed with the following equation: timeInBed = minutesToFallAsleep + minutesAsleep + minutesAwake + minutesAfterWakeup

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: date
args.info: Required: The date of records to be returned. In the format yyyy-MM-dd.

args.name: isMainSleep
args.info: Optional: If you need to fetch data only for the user's main sleep event, you can send the request with isMainSleep=true

blocks.name: getSleepTimeSeries
blocks.description: This endpoint returns time series data in the specified range for a given resource in the format requested using units in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: resourcePath
args.info: Required: The resource path; see the Resource Path Options in README for a list of options.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Required: The range start date, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Required: The end date of the range, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today. Also supported values: 1d, 7d, 30d, 1w, 1m, 3m, 6m, 1y, or max. Remember that with short code endpoint will return data earlier startDate. See README for more details and examples.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The language to use for response values. Language is used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getHeartRateTimeSeries
blocks.description: This endpoint returns time series data in the specified range for a given resource in the format requested using units in the unit systems that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Required: The range start date, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Required: The end date of the range, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today. Also supported values: 1d, 7d, 30d, 1w, 1m, 3m, 6m, 1y, or max. Remember that with short code endpoint will return data earlier startDate. See README for more details and examples.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The language to use for response values. Language is used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getHeartRateIntradayTimeSeries
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the intraday time series for a given resource in the format requested. If your application has the appropriate access, your calls to a time series endpoint for a specific day (by using start and end dates on the same day or a period of 1d), the response will include extended intraday values with a one-minute detail level for that day.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Required: The range start date, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Required: The end date of the range, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today. Also supported values: 1d, 7d, 30d, 1w, 1m, 3m, 6m, 1y, or max. Remember that with short code endpoint will return data earlier startDate.

args.name: detailLevel
args.info: Required: Number of data points to include. Either 1sec or 1min.

args.name: startTime
args.info: Optional: The start of the period, in the format HH:mm.

args.name: endTime
args.info: Optional: The end of the period, in the format HH:mm.

blocks.name: getFriendsLeaderboard
blocks.description: This endpoint gets the user's friends leaderboard in the format requested using units in the unit system which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

blocks.name: getFriends
blocks.description: This endpoint returns data of a user's friends in the format requested using units in the unit system which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The language to use for response values. Language is used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getFriendInvitations
blocks.description: This endpoint returns data of a user's friends in the format requested using units in the unit system which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

blocks.name: inviteFriend
blocks.description: This endpoint creates an invitation to become friends with the authorized user. Warning: Be careful when using the Invite Friend endpoint and, as always, adhere to the Terms of Service. Though Fitbit has organic limits on allowed number of invitations, your application's workflow must not allow users to send bulk invitations to users. Doing so could be considered SPAM.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: invitedUserEmail
args.info: Optional: Email of the user to invite. Does not need to be a Fitbit member. Either invitedUserEmail or invitedUserId is required.

args.name: invitedUserId
args.info: Optional: Encoded ID of the invited user. Either invitedUserEmail or invitedUserId is required.

blocks.name: respondToFriendInvitation
blocks.description: This endpoint accepts or rejects an invitation to become friends with inviting user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: fromUserId
args.info: Required: Encoded ID of user from which to accept or reject invitation.

args.name: accept
args.info: Required: Accept or reject invitation. 'true' or 'false'.

blocks.name: getFoodLocales
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the food locales that the user may choose to search, log, and create food in.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

blocks.name: getFoodGoals
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a user's current daily calorie consumption goal and/or food Plan in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

blocks.name: getWaterLogs
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves a summary and list of a user's water log entries for a given day in the format requested using units in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: date
args.info: Required: The date of records to be returned. In the format yyyy-MM-dd.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The language to use for response values. Language is used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getWaterGoal
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a user's current water goal.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

blocks.name: getFoodOrWaterTimeSeries
blocks.description: This endpoint returns time series data in the specified range for a given resource in the format requested using units in the unit systems that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: resourcePath
args.info: Required: The resource path. Possible options are: foods/log/caloriesIn, foods/log/water.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Required: The range start date, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today

args.name: endDate
args.info: Required: The end date of the range, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today. Also supported values: 1d, 7d, 30d, 1w, 1m, 3m, 6m, 1y. See examples in a README.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The language to use for response values. Language is used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: createFoodLog
blocks.description: This endpoint endpoint creates a log entry for a food event and returns a response in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: foodId
args.info: Optional: ID of the food to be logged. Either foodId or foodName must be provided.

args.name: foodName
args.info: Optional: Food entry name. Either foodId or foodName must be provided.

args.name: mealTypeId
args.info: Required: Meal type. 1=Breakfast; 2=Morning Snack; 3=Lunch; 4=Afternoon Snack; 5=Dinner; 7=Anytime.

args.name: unitId
args.info: Required: ID of units used. Typically retrieved via a previous call to Get Food Logs, Search Foods, or Get Food Units.

args.name: amount
args.info: Required: Amount consumed; in the format X.XX, in the specified unitId.

args.name: date
args.info: Required: Log entry date; in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

args.name: favorite
args.info: Optional: true will add the food to the user's favorites after creating the log entry; false will not. Valid only with foodId.

args.name: brandName
args.info: Optional: Brand name of food. Valid only with foodName parameter.

args.name: calories
args.info: Optional: Calories for this serving size. Allowed with foodName parameter (defaults to zero); otherwise ignored.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The language to use for response values. Language is used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: updateFoodLog
blocks.description: This endpoint changes the quantity or calories consumed for a user's food log entry with the given ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: foodLogId
args.info: Required: The ID of the food log to edit.

args.name: mealTypeId
args.info: Required: Meal type. 1=Breakfast; 2=Morning Snack; 3=Lunch; 4=Afternoon Snack; 5=Dinner; 7=Anytime.

args.name: unitId
args.info: Optional: ID of units used. Not required if the food log was created with the foodName parameter. Typically retrieved via a previous call to Get Food Logs, Search Foods, or Get Food Units.

args.name: amount
args.info: Optional: Amount consumed; Not required if the food log was created with the foodName parameter. In the format X.XX, in the specified unitId.

args.name: calories
args.info: Optional: Calories for this food log. Allowed if the food log was created with the foodName parameter (defaults to zero); otherwise ignored.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The language to use for response values. Language is used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: logWater
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a log entry for water using units in the unit systems that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: date
args.info: Required: Log entry date; in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

args.name: amount
args.info: Required: Amount consumed; in the format X.X and in the specified waterUnit or in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: unit
args.info: Optional: Water measurement unit. "ml", "fl oz", or "cup".

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The language to use for response values. Language is used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: updateFoodGoal
blocks.description: This endpoint updates or creates a user's daily calorie consumption goal or food plan and returns a response in the format requested. Food plan exists only if user already as an active weight goal crated via the Update Weight Goal endpoint.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: calories
args.info: Optional: Manual calorie consumption goal in integer format. Either calories or intensity must be provided.

args.name: intensity
args.info: Optional: Food plan intensity (MAINTENANCE, EASIER, MEDIUM, KINDAHARD, or HARDER). Either calories or intensity must be provided.

args.name: personalized
args.info: Optional: Food plan type; true or false.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for parameters and response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

args.name: acceptLocale
args.info: Optional: The locale to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: updateWaterGoal
blocks.description: This endpoint updates or creates a user's daily calorie consumption goal or food plan and returns a response in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: target
args.info: Required: Target water goal in the format X.X is set in unit based on locale.

blocks.name: updateWaterLog
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to update a water log.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: waterLogId
args.info: Required: The ID of water log.

args.name: amount
args.info: Required: Amount consumed; in the format X.X and in the specified waterUnit or in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: unit
args.info: Optional: Water measurement unit. "ml", "fl oz", or "cup".

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for parameters and response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: deleteWaterLog
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a user's water log entry with the given ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: waterLogId
args.info: Required: The id of the water log entry to be deleted.

blocks.name: getFavoriteFoods
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of a user's favorite foods in the format requested. A favorite food in the list provides a quick way to log the food via the Log Food endpoint.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getFrequentFoods
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of a user's frequent foods in the format requested. A frequent food in the list provides a quick way to log the food via the Log Food endpoint.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getRecentFoods
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of a user's recent foods in the format requested. A recent food provides a quick way to log the food via the Log Food endpoint.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: addFavoriteFood
blocks.description: This endpoint adds a food with the given ID to the user's list of favorite foods.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: foodId
args.info: Required: The ID of the food to be removed.

blocks.name: deleteFavoriteFood
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a food with the given ID to the user's list of favorite foods.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: foodId
args.info: Required: The ID of the food to be removed.

blocks.name: getMeals
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of meals created by user in his or her food log in the format requested. Meals in the list provide a quick way to log several foods at a time via the calls to the Log Food endpoint.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: createMeal
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a meal with the given food contained in the post body.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: name
args.info: Required: Name of the meal.

args.name: description
args.info: Required: Short description of the meal.

args.name: mealFoods
args.info: Required: Array of json objects. Object must contain foodId, unitId, amount. Ex.: [{"foodId" : <value>,"amount" : <value>,"unitId" : <value>}]. See README for more details and examples.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getSingleMeal
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves a meal for a user given the meal id.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: mealId
args.info: Required: The ID of the meal.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: editMeal
blocks.description: This endpoint replaces an existing meal with the contents of the request. The response contains the updated meal.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: mealId
args.info: Required: The ID of the meal to update.

args.name: name
args.info: Required: Name of the meal.

args.name: description
args.info: Required: Short description of the meal.

args.name: mealFoods
args.info: Required: Array of json objects. Object must contain foodId, unitId, amount. Ex.: [{"foodId" : <value>,"amount" : <value>,"unitId" : <value>}]. See README for more details and examples.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: deleteMeal
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to delete a user's meal with the given meal id.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: mealId
args.info: Required: The ID of the meal.

blocks.name: createFood
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a new private food for a user and returns a response in the format requested. The created food is found via the Search Foods call.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: name
args.info: Required: Food name.

args.name: defaultFoodMeasurementUnitId
args.info: Required: ID of the default measurement unit. Full list of units can be retrieved via the Get Food Units endpoint.

args.name: defaultServingSize
args.info: Required: Size of the default serving. Nutritional values should be provided for this serving size.

args.name: calories
args.info: Required: Calories in the default serving size.

args.name: formType
args.info: Optional: Form type (LIQUID or DRY.).

args.name: description
args.info: Optional: Description of the food.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: deleteCustomFood
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes custom food for a user and returns a response in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: foodId
args.info: Required: The ID of the food to be deleted.

blocks.name: getFood
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the details of a specific food in the Fitbit food database or a private food the authorized user has entered in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: foodId
args.info: Required: The ID of the food to be deleted.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getFoodUnits
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of all valid Fitbit food units in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: searchFoods
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of public foods from Fitbit foods database and private foods the user created in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: query
args.info: Required: The URL-encoded search query.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getFoodLogs
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a summary and list of a user's food log entries for a given day in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: date
args.info: Required: The date of records to be returned. In the format yyyy-MM-dd.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: Used to determine the food measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: deleteFoodLog
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a user's food log entry with the given ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: foodLogId
args.info: Required: The id of the food log entry to be deleted.

blocks.name: getDevices
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of the Fitbit devices connected to a user's account.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

blocks.name: getAlarms
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of the set alarms connected to a user's account.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: trackerId
args.info: Required: The ID of the tracker for which data is returned. The tracker-id value is found via the Get Devices endpoint.

blocks.name: addAlarm
blocks.description: This endpoint adds the alarm settings to a given ID for a given device.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: trackerId
args.info: Required: The ID of the tracker for which data is returned. The tracker-id value is found via the Get Devices endpoint.

args.name: time
args.info: Required: Time of day that the alarm vibrates with a UTC timezone offset, e.g. 07:15-08:00.

args.name: enabled
args.info: Required: true or false. If false, alarm does not vibrate until enabled is set to true.

args.name: recurring
args.info: Required: true or false. If false, the alarm is a single event.

args.name: weekDays
args.info: Required: Comma separated list of days of the week on which the alarm vibrates, e.g. MONDAY,TUESDAY

blocks.name: updateAlarm
blocks.description: This endpoint updates the alarm entry with a given ID for a given device. It also gets a response in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: trackerId
args.info: Required: The ID of the tracker for which data is returned. The tracker-id value is found via the Get Devices endpoint.

args.name: alarmId
args.info: Required: The ID of the alarm to be updated. The alarm-id value is found in the response of the Get Alarms endpoint.

args.name: time
args.info: Required: Time of day that the alarm vibrates with a UTC timezone offset, e.g. 07:15-08:00.

args.name: enabled
args.info: Required: true or false. If false, alarm does not vibrate until enabled is set to true.

args.name: recurring
args.info: Required: true or false. If false, the alarm is a single event.

args.name: weekDays
args.info: Required: Comma separated list of days of the week on which the alarm vibrates, e.g. MONDAY,TUESDAY

args.name: snoozeLength
args.info: Required: Minutes between alarms; integer value.

args.name: snoozeCount
args.info: Required: Maximum snooze count; integer value.

args.name: label
args.info: Optional: Label for the alarm; string value.

args.name: vibe
args.info: Optional: Vibe pattern; only one value for now - DEFAULT.

blocks.name: deleteAlarm
blocks.description: This endpoint allow to delete the user's device alarm entry with the given ID for a given device.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: trackerId
args.info: Required: The ID of the tracker whose alarms is managed. The tracker-id value is found via the Get Devices endpoint.

args.name: alarmId
args.info: Required: The ID of the alarm that is updated. The alarm-id value is found via the Get Alarms endpoint

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getBodyFatLogs
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of all user's body fat log entries for a given day in the format requested. Body fat log entries are available only to authorized user. If you need to fetch only the most recent entry, you can use the Get Body Measurements endpoint.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Required: The date in the format yyyy-MM-dd or "today".

args.name: endDate
args.info: Optional: The date in the format yyyy-MM-dd or 1d, 7d, 1w, 1m. Note: The range should not be longer than 31 days.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: logBodyFat
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a log entry for body fat and returns a response in the format requested. Note: The returned Body Fat Log IDs are unique to the user, but not globally unique.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: fat
args.info: Required: Body fat; in the format X.XX, in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: date
args.info: Required: Log entry date; in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

args.name: time
args.info: Optional: Time of the measurement; hours and minutes in the format HH:mm:ss, set to the last second of the day if not provided.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: deleteBodyFatLog
blocks.description: This endpoint allow to delete a user's body fat log entry with the given ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: bodyFatLogId
args.info: Required: The ID of the body fat log entry.

blocks.name: getBodyTimeSeries
blocks.description: This endpoint return time series data in the specified range for a given resource in the format requested using units in the unit systems that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: resourcePath
args.info: Required: The resource path. Options are "bmi", "fat", or "weight".

args.name: startDate
args.info: Required: The range start date, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Required: The range end date, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or one of options. Options are today, 1d, 7d, 30d, 1w, 1m, 3m, 6m, 1y, or max.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The language to use for response values. Language is used to determine the activity measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getBodyGoals
blocks.description: This endpoint allow to retrieve a user's current body fat percentage or weight goal using units in the unit systems that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: goalType
args.info: Required: The type of goal for which data is returned. Possible values: weight or fat.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: updateBodyFatGoal
blocks.description: This endpoint create or update user's fat percentage goal.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: fat
args.info: Required: Target body fat percentage; in the format X.XX.

blocks.name: updateWeightGoal
blocks.description: This endpoint create or update user's fat or weight goal using units in the unit systems that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided in the format requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Required: Weight goal start date; in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

args.name: startWeight
args.info: Required: Weight goal start weight; in the format X.XX, in the unit systems that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: weight
args.info: Optional: Weight goal target weight; in the format X.XX, in the unit systems that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided; required if user doesn't have an existing weight goal.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getWeightLogs
blocks.description: This endpoint allow to retrieve a list of all user's body weight log entries for a given day using units in the unit systems which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided. Body weight log entries are available only to authorized user. Body weight log entries in response are sorted exactly the same as they are presented on the Fitbit website.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Required: The range start date, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Required: The range end date, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or one of options. Options are today, 1d, 7d, 30d, 1w, 1m. Note: The period must not be longer than 31 days.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: logWeight
blocks.description: This endpoint create log entry for a body weight using units in the unit systems that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided and get a response in the format requested. Note: The returned Weight Log IDs are unique to the user, but not globally unique.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: weight
args.info: Required: Weight - in the format X.XX.

args.name: date
args.info: Required: Log entry date - in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

args.name: time
args.info: Optional: Time of the measurement - hours and minutes in the format HH:mm:ss, which is set to the last second of the day if time is not provided.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: deleteWeightLog
blocks.description: This endpoint allow to delete a user's body weight log entry with the given ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: bodyWeightLogId
args.info: Required: The ID of the body weight log entry.

blocks.name: getDailyActivitySummary
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves a summary and list of a user's activities and activity log entries for a given day in the format requested using units in the unit system which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: date
args.info: Required: The date in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

args.name: acceptLocale
args.info: Optional: The locale to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getActivityIntradayTimeSeries
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the Intraday Time Series for a given resource in the format requested. The endpoint mimics the Get Activity Time Series endpoint.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: resourcePath
args.info: Required: The resource path of the desired data. Possible values: activities/calories, activities/steps, activities/distance, activities/floors, activities/elevation

args.name: date
args.info: Required: The date, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today.

args.name: detailLevel
args.info: Optional: Number of data points to include. Either 1min or 15min.

args.name: startTime
args.info: Optional: The start of the period, in the format HH:mm

args.name: endTime
args.info: Optional: The end of the period, in the format HH:mm

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The language to use for response values. Language is used to determine the activity measurement units returned. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getActivityTCX
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves the details of a user's location and heart rate data during a logged exercise activity.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: logId
args.info: Required: The activity's log ID. See README to find out how get logId.

blocks.name: browseActivityTypes
blocks.description: Get a tree of all valid Fitbit public activities from the activities catalog as well as private custom activities the user created in the format requested. If the activity has levels, also get a list of activity level details. Typically, an applications retrieve the complete list of activities once at startup to cache and show in the UI later.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

blocks.name: getActivityType
blocks.description: Returns the details of a specific activity in the Fitbit activities database in the format requested. If activity has levels, also returns a list of activity level details.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: activityId
args.info: Required: The activity ID.

args.name: acceptLocale
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getFrequentActivities
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of a user's frequent activities in the format requested using units in the unit system which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided. A frequent activity record contains the distance and duration values recorded the last time the activity was logged. The record retrieved can be used to log the activity via the Log Activity endpoint with the same or adjusted values for distance and duration.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

args.name: acceptLocale
args.info: Optional: The locale to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getRecentActivityTypes
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of a user's recent activities types logged with some details of the last activity log of that type using units in the unit system which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided. The record retrieved can be used to log the activity via the Log Activity endpoint with the same or adjusted values for distance and duration.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

args.name: acceptLocale
args.info: Optional: The locale to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getFavoriteActivities
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of a user's favorite activities.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

blocks.name: addFavoriteActivity
blocks.description: This endpoint add the activity with the given ID to user's list of favorite activities.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: activityId
args.info: Required: The ID of the activity to add to user's favorites.

blocks.name: deleteFavoriteActivity
blocks.description: This endpoint remove the activity with the given ID from a user's list of favorite activities.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: activityId
args.info: Required: The ID of the activity to be removed.

blocks.name: getActivityGoals
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieve a user's current daily or weekly activity goals using measurement units as defined in the unit system, which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: period
args.info: Required: The period to be returned. Possible values: daily or weekly.

blocks.name: updateActivityGoals
blocks.description: This endpoint create or update a user's daily activity goals and return a response using units in the unit system which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: period
args.info: Required: The period to be updated. Possible values: daily or weekly.

args.name: caloriesOut
args.info: Optional: Goal value for calories.

args.name: activeMinutes
args.info: Optional: Goal value for active minutes.

args.name: floors
args.info: Optional: Goal value.

args.name: distance
args.info: Optional: Goal value for distance. Format X.XX or integer.

args.name: steps
args.info: Optional: Goal value for steps.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getLifetimeStats
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves the user's activity statistics in the format requested using units in the unit system which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided. Activity statistics includes Lifetime and Best achievement values from the My Achievements tile on the website dashboard. Response contains both statistics from the tracker device and total numbers including tracker data and manual activity log entries as seen on the Fitbit website dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: getActivityTimeSeries
blocks.description: This endpoint returns time series data in the specified range for a given resource in the format requested using units in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: userId
args.info: Required: The encoded ID of the user. Use "-" (dash) for current logged-in user.

args.name: resourcePath
args.info: Required: The resource path; see README for more details.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Required: The range start date, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Required: The range end date, in the format yyyy-MM-dd or today. Also possible values for period: 1d, 7d, 30d, 1w, 1m, 3m, 6m, 1y. If uses period values, startDate will be end date for period.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Optional: The measurement unit system to use for response values. Example: en_US. For more details see README.

blocks.name: addSubscription
blocks.description: You must add a subscription in your application so that users will get notifications and return a response in the format requested. The subscriptionId value provides a way to associate an update with a particular user stream in your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: collectionPath
args.info: Optional: This is the resource of the collection to receive notifications from (foods, activities, sleep, or body). If not present, subscription will be created for all collections. If you have both all and specific collection subscriptions, you will get duplicate notifications on that collections' updates. Each subscriber can have only one subscription for a specific user's collection. See README for more details.

args.name: subscriptionId
args.info: Required: This is the unique ID of the subscription created by the API client application. Each ID must be unique across the entire set of subscribers and collections. The Fitbit servers will pass this ID back along with any notifications about the user indicated by the user parameter in the URL path.

args.name: xFitbitSubscriberId
args.info: Optional: The ID of the subscriber to receive notifications, as defined on dev.fitbit.com. If not present, the default subscriber is used.

blocks.name: getSubscriptions
blocks.description: Get a list of a user's subscriptions for your application in the format requested. You can either fetch subscriptions for a specific collection or the entire list of subscriptions for the user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: collectionPath
args.info: Optional: Collection to get subscriptions for (foods, activities, sleep, or body.) If not present, list will include all subscriptions for the user.

blocks.name: removeSubscription
blocks.description: Deletes a subscription for a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: The access token obtained from getAccessToken method.

args.name: subscriptionId
args.info: Required: The ID of the subscription.

args.name: collectionPath
args.info: Optional: Collection to delete subscription form (foods, activities, sleep, or body.). If not present, subscriptions will be deleted from all collections.

args.name: xFitbitSubscriberId
args.info: Optional: The ID of the subscriber to receive notifications, as defined on dev.fitbit.com. If not present, the default subscriber is used. Recommended to fill.
